intro: Pedicularis kashmiriana, commonly known as the Kashmir orchid, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orobanchaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas, particularly in Kashmir and neighboring areas. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often with a distinctive spurred petal. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
